Jersey noun
(ISLAND)
an island in the English Channel. It is the largest of the group of islands known as the Channel Islands: We stayed at the Mayfair Hotel in St Helier, Jersey. The company is based on Jersey in the Channel Islands.
More examplesFewer examplesJersey, an island with a population of 86,000, employs 13,000 people in financial services.Jersey officials feared that inclusion on the list would be damaging to the island's economy. Jersey Police declined to comment last night.

a shirt, esp. one that is part of a uniform: I have to wash my daughter’s softball jersey.
Jersey is also a type of soft, knitted cloth: She was dressed in a jersey top and jeans. She wanted a wintry fabric such as flannel, heavy jersey, or merino wool.
